There is a separate modern fitted kitchen with integrated Gagganau appliances and ample worktop space. There are 2 double bedrooms, the second bedroom offering built in wardrobes and located next to a family shower room, whilst the master bedroom suite benefits from having 2 Juliet balconies, a walk in wardrobe and a stunning en suite bathroom with his and hers sinks, a jacuzzi bath and a shower/steam enclosure.The entrance hall has a spiral staircase leading to the tenth floor which has a generous triple aspect summer room with floor to ceiling windows that lead out to a vast panoramic terrace. agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: 10 Park Drive by Stanton WilliamsSet on a wonderful waterfront location 10 Park Drive affords panoramic views across South Dock, Canary Wharf and the Thames beyond. It is a remarkable addition to Canary Wharf’s already globally recognised skyline. Careful attention to detail and the use of high-quality tactile materials produce well-proportioned and naturally bright, apartment interiors. Each apartment is deliberately designed as a highly individual space. Daylight and sightlines have influenced every aspect of the design. Private gardens at the base of the building overlook the park, the boardwalk and the magic of the water. Enticing common areas connect with vibrant public spaces to create a dynamic living environment.Development Includes:– Located on Canary Wharf’s 128 acre private Estate– Residents Skygarden– Outstanding location surrounded by parks and waterways– 24 hour security / concierge– Residents’ membership to state of the art health club by Third SpaceThe apartments by Make ArchitectsThe apartments have been designed by celebrated interior designers Make. The choice of materials, colours and finishes have been carefully selected to complement the building’s exterior and make the most of the natural light.The Residents’ Club and SkygardenThe sense of limitless living reaches its ultimate expression in the private Residents Club and Skygarden on the 13th floor that overlooks the Estate, the City and the ever meandering Thames. This spectacular terrace and contemporary lounge unify interior and exterior.State of the art health club by Third SpaceResidents of 10 Park Drive will have membership of a stunning health and fitness club opposite to the building. Alongside the swimming pool, the club will contain a state-of-the-art gym, exercise area, Jacuzzi, sauna and steam rooms. The club will also contain a studio for Pilates, stretch yoga and related fitness classes. Private treatment rooms will be available for residents to indulge in a broad range of therapies and technique.Canary Wharf’s Private EstateThe 128-acre private Estate is one of the world’s great city spaces; internationally renowned as one of the capital’s most vibrant districts with a unique waterside location, enriched by London’s largest collection of outdoor public art and cultural programme of 200 events and exhibitions throughout the year.The Group’s careful stewardship over the last 30 years also means it’s recognised for being both beautifully maintained and reassuringly safe.Canary Wharf’s new neighbourhood, Wood WharfFor the last three decades, Canary Wharf has been a thriving centre of business, retail and culture that has shifted London’s centre of gravity east. And now one of the most exciting evolutions in the Estate’s history has begun: The creation of a new neighbourhood, Wood Wharf.Wood Wharf will provide the very best in urban living and soon, you’ll be able to walk across the bridge from Montgomery Square and experience the neighbourhood – the open spaces, the vibrant new shops, bars and restaurants and tranquil watersides.The creation of the residential district represents a unique opportunity to live on the private Estate and, as of spring next year, residents of 10 Park Drive will move into their apartments and become one of the first people to call Wood Wharf home.

Holland Properties are pleased to offer this rare warehouse home of over 3380sq ft, set amongst a row of bespoke converted warehouses over-looking Limehouse Cut. Currently arranged as a three bedroom home on Narrow Street. An impressive entrance leads to a wide hallway, with an integral garage entrance, and storage space. Access to the second bedroom, with en-suite bathroom facilities; built in wardrobes and windows, provide a south easterly aspect over Limehouse Cut- an inlet to the River Thames. An open staircase with feature exposed brickwork leads to all levels. The first floor currently offers two generously sized bedrooms with the main bedroom benefitting from a lavish suite with feature bathroom and extensive wardrobes. The large third bedroom provides a bright aspect over the Cut. The stairs continue to the second floor which provides an abundance of natural light, spreading across the kitchen; which has fully integrated appliances and a bespoke circular window. The reception room offers a wonderfully bright room with excellent storage and distinctive design features.

displayable_address: Park Drive, Canary Wharf, London E14
agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: One Park Drive is a single harmonious building, however its 58 storeys are made up of three typologies, each with its own distinct characteristics.Bay Apartment 4804The spiraling top of the building includes the Bay apartments. At these levels the orthogonal geometry of the apartment planning interfaces with the implicit curved form of the building creating the opportunity for double height balconies with exceptional views.The dramatic form created from the three overlapping floorplates provides an elegant termination to a building of such complexity.The selected finishes bring substance to the larger luxurious apartments at these levels borrowing their form and texture from, but not imitating, the architecture of the building.One Park DriveDesigned by Herzog & de Meuron, One Park Drive is the new district's signature building. Positioned at the head of the dock, it proudly represents everything that makes the new neighbourhood so special - a unique architectural achievement thoughtfully designed to be the very best in city and waterside living.Development includes:The first residential building by Herzog & de Meuron in the UKLocated on Canary Wharf's 128 acre private EstateA full suite of residential amenities over 2 floorsOutstanding location surrounded by parks and waterwaysIncredible level of specificationTerraces to all apartmentsThe lower floors contain the Loft apartments - some of One Park Drive's largest apartments. With high ceilings and wrap-around terraces, they are designed to make the most of the connection to both the green spaces and the waterfront.The Cluster forms the heart of the building. It is the typology that contains the greatest variety of apartments. The lower levels are connected with the parks and the water, the higher floors with the sky.The upper floors contain the Bay apartments. They have double-height terraces which are set back into the building. Their design is focused on maximising light and the views across London.Every apartment has terraces designed to work seamlessly with the interior living spaces. There is also great variety; many of the Cluster apartments have two outside areas, the Lofts have expansive wrap-around terraces and the Bay apartment terraces have double-height space above them. Each terrace is naturally sheltered within the building's form, yet connected with the scenery beyond. They're spaces that invite you outside.The apartment interiors deliver a complexity and surprise that complements One Park Drive's powerful exterior form, as well as creating a sense of calm and a luxurious intimacy.The interiors focus on natural materials and finishes throughout with special attention being paid to the tactile surfaces. The three typologies so powerfully expressed in the exterior architecture have their own distinct yet harmonious personalities.One Park Drive celebrates its communal spaces. Spread across the ground and first floors, they are all fully integrated into the life of the building and positively engage with its surroundings.The reception, concierge, lounge, library and cinema are all on the ground floor. The first floor houses the exclusive health club including a 20-metre pool, gym, studio space and spa. Dramatic floor-to-ceiling glazing invites stunning views across the surrounding parks, gardens and water.Canary Wharf & Wood Wharf EstateCanary Wharf Group's careful stewardship of the private Canary Wharf Estate over the past 30 years has made it one of the safest, connected, best maintained and most vibrant districts in the capital. And now the most exciting evolution in the Estate's history has begun - the creation of the new residential district.It will be a neighbourhood of green spaces and waterside boardwalks. A neighbourhood that's both an oasis of calm and one of the most well connected in Europe. A neighbourhood where it will be just as easy to grab the essentials of daily life as it will be to take in live music or theatre. It will be a local neighbourhood with all the benefits of being part of a private Estate.

DescriptionThe apartmentLocated in the west tower of Wardian London at Canary Wharf. The plot set on the top 48th&49th of the building. This dual aspect apartment offers spectacular views over the South & West London skyline. Benefiting from an impressive 1268 sq ft, the apartment comprises two bedrooms both en-suite on the top 49th floor, an open-plan kitchen with dining area and living room, also a guest bathroom on the 48th floor.The DevelopmentEcoworld and Ballymore worked together on Wardian London, one of the most visionary projects London has seen in recent years. Combining modern architecture with innovative landscaping, it sets a new standard for the high-rise living experience - put simply, a tranquil haven of nature in the heart of London's new financial centre.In the midst of the skyscrapers and waterways of Canary Wharf, Wardian London offers an oasis of nature. Comprising two iconic apartment towers with restaurants, curated shops and stunning facilities, the vision is to create a new address like no other, a haven of peace and beauty in the heart of London.Wardian's apartments do not just have balconies but fully-fledged private gardens. The spacious exteriors mean the benefit of an expansive outdoor area, rare in such a central setting, is granted to each apartment.Location and transportLocated in the heart of London's fastest growing business district, Wardian is incredibly well connected.- Canary Wharf train station offering immediate access to the underground and the DLR line is within a 6 minute walk.- Jubilee, being one of the most centrally connected lines, is at your immediate disposal.- The bus is also available reaching Mile End in 18 mins and Liverpool Street in 37 mins.

Penthouse apartment Rarely available, premium, two bedroom duplex apartment with two parking spaces, available in Wardian's West Tower boasting city views. Spread across c.1268 sq ft the property comprises an open plan kitchen living area with breakfast bar island, W/C, wrap around terrace c.291 sq ft, two double bedrooms with built in storage and both boasting ensuite bathrooms. This impressive property located on the 48th and 49th floors is dual aspect with far reaching southerly views and westerly views to the city. Residents of Wardian will benefit from 24/7 concierge, 25m pool, roof garden & observatory, cinema, gym and business lounge.Wardian is ideally located in Canary Wharf which has now overtaken the City of London as Europe's pre eminent financial hub. The location enjoys unparalleled transport connections including the Jubilee Line, Docklands Light Railway, Thames Clipper boat services and European flights via London City Airport, and Canary Wharf will also be a key station for the major new east west railway line Crossrail.Photos are for illustrative purposes only, apartments may vary.

displayable_address: One Park Drive, Canary Wharf, London E14
agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: Bay - Plot 3404The spiralling top of the building includes the Bay apartments. At these levels the orthogonal geometry of the apartment planning interfaces with the implicit curved form of the building creating the opportunity for double height balconies with exceptional views.The dramatic form created from the three overlapping floorplates provides an elegant termination to a building of such complexity.The selected finishes bring substance to the larger luxurious apartments at these levels borrowing their form and texture from, but not imitating, the architecture of the building.Designed by Herzog & de Meuron, One Park Drive is the new district's signature building. Positioned at the head of the dock, it proudly represents everything that makes the new neighbourhood so special - a unique architectural achievement thoughtfully designed to be the very best in city and waterside living.Development includes:The first residential building by Herzog & de Meuron in the UKLocated on Canary Wharf's 128 acre private EstateA full suite of residential amenities over 2 floorsOutstanding location surrounded by parks and waterwaysIncredible level of specificationTerraces to all apartmentsOne Park Drive is a single harmonious building, however its 58 storeys are made up of three typologies, each with its own distinct characteristics.The lower floors contain the Loft apartments - some of One Park Drive's largest apartments. With high ceilings and wrap-around terraces, they are designed to make the most of the connection to both the green spaces and the waterfront.The Cluster forms the heart of the building. It is the typology that contains the greatest variety of apartments. The lower levels are connected with the parks and the water, the higher floors with the sky.The upper floors contain the Bay apartments. They have double-height terraces which are set back into the building. Their design is focused on maximising light and the views across London.Every apartment has terraces designed to work seamlessly with the interior living spaces. There is also great variety; many of the Cluster apartments have two outside areas, the Lofts have expansive wrap-around terraces and the Bay apartment terraces have double-height space above them. Each terrace is naturally sheltered within the building's form, yet connected with the scenery beyond. They're spaces that invite you outside.The apartment interiors deliver a complexity and surprise that complements One Park Drive's powerful exterior form, as well as creating a sense of calm and a luxurious intimacy.The interiors focus on natural materials and finishes throughout with special attention being paid to the tactile surfaces. The three typologies so powerfully expressed in the exterior architecture have their own distinct yet harmonious personalities.One Park Drive celebrates its communal spaces. Spread across the ground and first floors, they are all fully integrated into the life of the building and positively engage with its surroundings.The reception, concierge, lounge, library and cinema are all on the ground floor. The first floor houses the exclusive health club including a 20-metre pool, gym, studio space and spa. Dramatic floor-to-ceiling glazing invites stunning views across the surrounding parks, gardens and water.Canary Wharf Group's careful stewardship of the private Canary Wharf Estate over the past 30 years has made it one of the safest, connected, best maintained and most vibrant districts in the capital. And now the most exciting evolution in the Estate's history has begun - the creation of the new residential district.It will be a neighbourhood of green spaces and waterside boardwalks. A neighbourhood that's both an oasis of calm and one of the most well connected in Europe. A neighbourhood where it will be just as easy to grab the essentials of daily life as it will be to take in live music or theatre. It will be a local neighbourhood with all the benefits of being part of a private Estate.

It was also a time when dear old developers needed more than a snazzy marketing ploy to tempt fledgeling hipsters out of their central London comfort zones. No, what they wanted was oversized space, bang for buck, and thats exactly what these early spaces offered.The apartment in question, crowns the top of this handsome, river fronted structure with its half moon cantilevered balcony taking in some of the graceful views of the Thames, which sweep from Canary Wharf to London Bridge.Inside it's light filled playground, two floors, one of which spans the entire apartment, with kitchen and dining area at one end and the cavernous living space at the other with roof voided ceilings and a full height picture window making the most of the unspoilt views on the other side.Up stairs there are two guest bedrooms and bathroom, plus the mezzanine'd master room with en-suite.At this end of Narrow Street you're within easy access of both Canary Wharf and the City, both of which are easily reached on foot or jump on the DLR which is moments on foot at Limehouse

agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: 10 Park Drive by Stanton WilliamsSet on a wonderful waterfront location 10 Park Drive affords panoramic views across South Dock, Canary Wharf and the Thames beyond. It is a remarkable addition to Canary Wharf’s already globally recognised skyline. Careful attention to detail and the use of high-quality tactile materials produce well-proportioned and naturally bright, apartment interiors. Each apartment is deliberately designed as a highly individual space. Daylight and sightlines have influenced every aspect of the design. Private gardens at the base of the building overlook the park, the boardwalk and the magic of the water. Enticing common areas connect with vibrant public spaces to create a dynamic living environment.Development Includes:– Located on Canary Wharf’s 128 acre private Estate– Residents Skygarden– Outstanding location surrounded by parks and waterways– 24 hour security / concierge– Residents’ membership to state of the art health club by Third SpaceThe apartments by Make ArchitectsThe apartments have been designed by celebrated interior designers Make. The choice of materials, colours and finishes have been carefully selected to complement the building’s exterior and make the most of the natural light.The Residents’ Club and SkygardenThe sense of limitless living reaches its ultimate expression in the private Residents Club and Skygarden on the 13th floor that overlooks the Estate, the City and the ever meandering Thames. This spectacular terrace and contemporary lounge unify interior and exterior.State of the art health club by Third SpaceResidents of 10 Park Drive will have membership of a stunning health and fitness club opposite to the building. Alongside the swimming pool, the club will contain a state-of-the-art gym, exercise area, Jacuzzi, sauna and steam rooms. The club will also contain a studio for Pilates, stretch yoga and related fitness classes. Private treatment rooms will be available for residents to indulge in a broad range of therapies and technique.Canary Wharf’s Private EstateThe 128-acre private Estate is one of the world’s great city spaces; internationally renowned as one of the capital’s most vibrant districts with a unique waterside location, enriched by London’s largest collection of outdoor public art and cultural programme of 200 events and exhibitions throughout the year.The Group’s careful stewardship over the last 30 years also means it’s recognised for being both beautifully maintained and reassuringly safe.Canary Wharf’s new neighbourhood, Wood WharfFor the last three decades, Canary Wharf has been a thriving centre of business, retail and culture that has shifted London’s centre of gravity east. And now one of the most exciting evolutions in the Estate’s history has begun: The creation of a new neighbourhood, Wood Wharf.Wood Wharf will provide the very best in urban living and soon, you’ll be able to walk across the bridge from Montgomery Square and experience the neighbourhood – the open spaces, the vibrant new shops, bars and restaurants and tranquil watersides.The creation of the residential district represents a unique opportunity to live on the private Estate and, as of spring next year, residents of 10 Park Drive will move into their apartments and become one of the first people to call Wood Wharf home.

description: Argo Building, Goodluck Hope2nd Floor - K203Located on the 2nd floor, this beautiful South East & South West facing three bedroom apartment features a 94 sqft balcony, a stunning fully fitted kitchen, three double bedrooms with en suite and main bathroom. Fitted wardrobes in the main bedroom and second bedroom.Living spaces at Goodluck Hope are a re-interpretation of the warehouse aesthetic, where the industrial past has been transformed. The design of living spaces throughout acknowledges the texture and strength of raw natural material resulting in a universally refined aesthetic and a welcoming, familiar atmosphere. Carefully chosen features, including uniquely designed faucets, machine made in brass and carrying the Goodluck Hope maker's mark, are symbols of craft and ingenuity and the development's attention to the smallest detail.About ArgoArgo will be the first building to be completed in the brand new Goodluck Hope development and will be the location of the exclusive residents' only 1595 Club. Sitting directly on the banks of the Thames and with incredible views across the water to the iconic O2 Arena, Canary Wharf and Emirates cable car.About Goodluck HopeGoodluck Hope is an industrially inspired luxury development, forged from London's enduring spirit, founded on an island heritage of industry, ingenuity and craft. It is a special project perfectly balancing waterfront prestige with the character of East London's creative culture.Goodluck Hope houses the exclusive '1595 Club' - a network of globally inspired exceptional amenities under one roof where residents can enjoy first class facilities to provide the finest in wellness, co-working and entertainment. The '1595 Club' consists of:The Picture House - on site cinema using state of the art sound and technologyThe Water House - 460 sqm swimming poolThe Steam House - Scandinavian style steam roomThe Sweat House - a New York inspired gymnasiumThe Work House - business centreThe Spice House - restaurant with panoramic viewsThe Courtyard - a sanctuary and a meeting place dressed with plants from across the globeThe Lantern Room - 29th floor spectacular viewing lounge and bar boasting panoramic views of The Thames and The CityConnectivityOne of the best connected sites in London with a 12 minute walk to its very own Jubilee Line and DLR station at Canning Town, 20 minutes to Bond Street, 15 minutes to Westminster. agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: One Park Drive is a single harmonious building, however its 58 storeys are made up of three typologies, each with its own distinct characteristics.The lower eight residential floors of One Park Drive feature the Loft apartments, benefiting from open plan living with exceptional ceiling heights normally only seen in penthouses.Working from the structure and external walls, the found space has been shaped with the minimal interventions necessary for modern life. The Lofts have expansive wrap-around terraces which are naturally sheltered within the building’s form, yet connected with the scenery beyond. They’re spaces that invite you outside.The free flowing space – divided with sliding walls and pivoted screens – anchors itself to the form of the building with seamless resin floors, sculpted bathrooms and curved ceiling profiles.The apartment interiors deliver a complexity and surprise that complements One Park Drive's powerful exterior form, as well as creating a sense of calm and a luxurious intimacy.The interiors focus on natural materials and finishes throughout with special attention being paid to the tactile surfaces. The three typologies so powerfully expressed in the exterior architecture have their own distinct yet harmonious personalities.One Park DriveDesigned by Herzog & de Meuron, One Park Drive is the new district's signature building. Positioned at the head of the dock, it proudly represents everything that makes the new neighbourhood so special - a unique architectural achievement thoughtfully designed to be the very best in city and waterside living.Development includes:The first residential building by Herzog & de Meuron in the UKLocated on Canary Wharf's 128 acre private EstateA full suite of residential amenities over 2 floorsOutstanding location surrounded by parks and waterwaysIncredible level of specificationTerraces to all apartmentsOne Park Drive celebrates its communal spaces. Spread across the ground and first floors, they are all fully integrated into the life of the building and positively engage with its surroundings.The reception, concierge, lounge, library and cinema are all on the ground floor. The first floor houses the exclusive 10,500 sq ft health club including a 20-metre pool, gym, studio space and spa. Dramatic floor-to-ceiling glazing invites stunning views across the surrounding parks, gardens and water.Canary Wharf & Wood Wharf EstateCanary Wharf Group's careful stewardship of the private Canary Wharf Estate over the past 30 years has made it one of the safest, connected, best maintained and most vibrant districts in the capital. And now the most exciting evolution in the Estate's history has begun - the creation of the new residential district.It will be a neighbourhood of green spaces and waterside boardwalks. A neighbourhood that's both an oasis of calm and one of the most well connected in Europe. A neighbourhood where it will be just as easy to grab the essentials of daily life as it will be to take in live music or theatre. It will be a local neighbourhood with all the benefits of being part of a private Estate.Marketing Suite & Show ApartmentsPlease call to arrange a viewing.

agent_name: Canary Wharf Residential - One Park & 10 Park Drive
description: One Park Drive is a single harmonious building, however its 58 storeys are made up of three typologies, each with its own distinct characteristics.Cluster ApartmentThe central section of the building features the interlocked Cluster apartments. The rhythmic alternating floor plates formed by the mirroring and rotation of apartment plans establishes visual complexity whilst maintaining clarity of internal space.The Cluster apartments integrate all elements from space planning to the material palette in a seamless way, harmonising with the approach to the exterior façade.The natural material selection works with texture and light to capture a calm interior sense and character linked to the external expression of the building.The lower levels are connected with the parks and the water, the higher floors with the sky.The apartment interiors deliver a complexity and surprise that complements One Park Drive's powerful exterior form, as well as creating a sense of calm and a luxurious intimacy.The interiors focus on natural materials and finishes throughout with special attention being paid to the tactile surfaces. The three typologies so powerfully expressed in the exterior architecture have their own distinct yet harmonious personalities.One Park DriveDesigned by Herzog & de Meuron, One Park Drive is the new district's signature building. Positioned at the head of the dock, it proudly represents everything that makes the new neighbourhood so special - a unique architectural achievement thoughtfully designed to be the very best in city and waterside living.Development includes:The first residential building by Herzog & de Meuron in the UKLocated on Canary Wharf's 128 acre private EstateA full suite of residential amenities over 2 floorsOutstanding location surrounded by parks and waterwaysIncredible level of specificationTerraces to all apartmentsOne Park Drive celebrates its communal spaces. Spread across the ground and first floors, they are all fully integrated into the life of the building and positively engage with its surroundings.The reception, concierge, lounge, library and cinema are all on the ground floor. The first floor houses the exclusive 10,500 sq ft health club including a 20-metre pool, gym, studio space and spa. Dramatic floor-to-ceiling glazing invites stunning views across the surrounding parks, gardens and water.Canary Wharf & Wood Wharf EstateCanary Wharf Group's careful stewardship of the private Canary Wharf Estate over the past 30 years has made it one of the safest, connected, best maintained and most vibrant districts in the capital. And now the most exciting evolution in the Estate's history has begun - the creation of the new residential district.It will be a neighbourhood of green spaces and waterside boardwalks. A neighbourhood that's both an oasis of calm and one of the most well connected in Europe. A neighbourhood where it will be just as easy to grab the essentials of daily life as it will be to take in live music or theatre. It will be a local neighbourhood with all the benefits of being part of a private Estate.Marketing Suite & Show ApartmentsPlease call to arrange a viewing.

DescriptionThe apartmentLocated in the west tower of Wardian London, the plot set on the high 46th floor of this 49 storey building. This dual aspect apartment offers spectacular views over the South & East London skyline. Benefiting from an impressive 1019 sq ft, the apartment comprises two bedrooms, with one en-suite master bedroom, an open-plan kitchen with dining area and living room, also a guest bathroom.The developmentEcoworld and Ballymore worked together on Wardian London, one of the most visionary projects London has seen in recent years. Combining modern architecture with innovative landscaping, it sets a new standard for the high-rise living experience - put simply, a tranquil haven of nature in the heart of London's new financial centre.In the midst of the skyscrapers and waterways of Canary Wharf, Wardian London offers an oasis of nature. Comprising two iconic apartment towers with restaurants, curated shops and stunning facilities, the vision is to create a new address like no other, a haven of peace and beauty in the heart of London.Wardian's apartments do not just have balconies but fully-fledged private gardens. The spacious exteriors mean the benefit of an expansive outdoor area, rare in such a central setting, is granted to each apartment.Location and transportLocated in the heart of London's fastest growing business district, Wardian is incredibly well connected.- Canary Wharf train station offering immediate access to the underground and the DLR line is within a 6 minute walk.- Jubilee, being one of the most centrally connected lines, is at your immediate disposal.- The bus is also available reaching Mile End in 18 mins and Liverpool Street in 37 mins.

A unique, modern development harnessing cutting edge design and innovation in the heart of the capital, providing luxury living accommodation and ever changing, natural scenery in the form of a mammoth, internal garden.The brief to the leading architects, landscape and interior designers that created Wardian was simple - to boldly pursue new ideas and create an address like no other, a haven of peace and beauty in the heart of London.The Wardian design is inspired by the work of one Londoner, the great explorer, botanist, and inventor, Nathaniel Bagshaw Ward. Ward changed the world with his botanical glass container 'the Wardian Case' and his influence can be felt throughout the building, with large glass cases of steel, glass and bronze showcasing plants from all over the world, providing an ever changing backdrop in line with the seasons. The planted environment spills out into the whole building, from the lush and verdant edges of Wardian's luxury open-air pool to the exquisite roof garden and observatory. Uniquely, the apartment also offers a fully-fledged private garden that wraps around the apartment, a rarity in such a prime central location, which can be enjoyed all year from the apartments striking floor to ceiling windows. Each garden is tailored to an individual owners taste, from lush to sleek minimalism.Located on the corner of the building upon the 46th floor, the magnificent open-plan kitchen/living area and spectacular private roof garden both enjoy a Southerly and Easterly aspect and take in breath-taking panorama of Docklands skyline. The floor-to-ceiling windows that encase the apartment not only provide an all year-round panorama but bathe the apartment in stunning natural light. The materials of wood, marble and glass used within the décor of the apartment mirrors that of the glass cases and the botanical life found extensively throughout the development. The two double bedrooms are beautifully proportioned and enjoy bespoke, inbuilt storage. The master suite benefits from the convenience of a stunning en-suite with roll top bath and walk in shower, with the family bathroom also enjoying a bath with shower overhead.Every resident of the Wardian benefits from membership to its first class facilities. The facilities include a cinema, 25 meter pool and gym including a spa, steam room and yoga studio, rooftop observatory and bar, private dining area, as well as a 24 hour concierge available to ensure there is always someone on hand to assist at any time of the day and night. In addition to the exclusive in-house facilities, the developments proximity to London's iconic landmarks, rail network and airports makes this the perfect location for residents who work both nationally and internationally and ensures time spent within the Wardian is always exciting.

description: 10 Park Drive by Stanton WilliamsSet on a wonderful waterfront location 10 Park Drive affords panoramic views across South Dock, Canary Wharf and the Thames beyond. It is a remarkable addition to Canary Wharf’s already globally recognised skyline. Careful attention to detail and the use of high-quality tactile materials produce well-proportioned and naturally bright, apartment interiors. Each apartment is deliberately designed as a highly individual space. Daylight and sightlines have influenced every aspect of the design. Private gardens at the base of the building overlook the park, the boardwalk and the magic of the water. Enticing common areas connect with vibrant public spaces to create a dynamic living environment.Development Includes:– Located on Canary Wharf’s 128 acre private Estate– Residents Skygarden– Outstanding location surrounded by parks and waterways– 24 hour security / concierge– Residents’ membership to state of the art health club by Third SpaceThe apartments by Make ArchitectsThe apartments have been designed by celebrated interior designers Make. The choice of materials, colours and finishes have been carefully selected to complement the building’s exterior and make the most of the natural light.The Residents’ Club and SkygardenThe sense of limitless living reaches its ultimate expression in the private Residents Club and Skygarden on the 13th floor that overlooks the Estate, the City and the ever meandering Thames. This spectacular terrace and contemporary lounge unify interior and exterior.State of the art health club by Third SpaceResidents of 10 Park Drive will have membership of a stunning health and fitness club opposite to the building. Alongside the swimming pool, the club will contain a state-of-the-art gym, exercise area, Jacuzzi, sauna and steam rooms. The club will also contain a studio for Pilates, stretch yoga and related fitness classes. Private treatment rooms will be available for residents to indulge in a broad range of therapies and technique.Canary Wharf’s Private EstateThe 128-acre private Estate is one of the world’s great city spaces; internationally renowned as one of the capital’s most vibrant districts with a unique waterside location, enriched by London’s largest collection of outdoor public art and cultural programme of 200 events and exhibitions throughout the year.The Group’s careful stewardship over the last 30 years also means it’s recognised for being both beautifully maintained and reassuringly safe.Canary Wharf’s new neighbourhood, Wood WharfFor the last three decades, Canary Wharf has been a thriving centre of business, retail and culture that has shifted London’s centre of gravity east. And now one of the most exciting evolutions in the Estate’s history has begun: The creation of a new neighbourhood, Wood Wharf.Wood Wharf will provide the very best in urban living and soon, you’ll be able to walk across the bridge from Montgomery Square and experience the neighbourhood – the open spaces, the vibrant new shops, bars and restaurants and tranquil watersides.The creation of the residential district represents a unique opportunity to live on the private Estate and, as of spring next year, residents of 10 Park Drive will move into their apartments and become one of the first people to call Wood Wharf home.

displayable_address: Dollar Bay Point, 3 Dollar Bay Place E14
description: Stunning 1384 sqft (inc W/G) 3 bedroom apartment | 21st floor | Large Winter Garden | Absolutely stunning views | Dual aspect to both South and West views directly of the dock, Canary Wharf skyline and also the River Thames | Exclusive development |Secure underground parking includedFeatures a superb dual aspect to both South and West with amazing views directly of the dock, Canary Wharf skyline and also the River Thames.This property also comes with secure underground parking. Open plan kitchen/ living area with high specification throughout, under floor heating, fully integrated Siemens appliances and built in wardrobes in the bedroom.This quality development offers 24hr concierge service, residents only gymnasium and private garden areas.Moments away from South Quay DLR and close to Canary Wharf with easy access to the shopping centres, restaurants, bars and all the other amenities Canary Wharf has to offer.999 year lease from 2016Canary Wharf Overview:An iconic London skyline, Canary Wharf is well known for being a worldwide leading financial and business centre, home to some of the largest global headquarters of major banks, media organisations and professional services firms. With over 100,000 people working in Canary Wharf at offices including those of hsbc, Barclays, Credit Suisse, Citigroup, kpmg and Morgan Stanley.Did you know?• In 1802, West India Docks were the world’s busiest shipping port and the heart of the British Empire.• Canary wharf is home to the biggest Waitrose in the country.• The average salary for Canary Wharf is £100,000 • 1,000 ships still pass through the docks each month.Property: Growing in popularity, Canary Wharf is now home to many prestigious residential developments, along with an impressive array of restaurants, bars, shops and leisure facilities, making it a highly desirable place to work and live. Sleek modern apartments with breath-taking views of the River Thames are just some of the fantastic properties on offer at Canary Wharf, the area has a multitude of housing styles. From luxury penthouses and modern warehouse conversions to Victorian terrace houses, there is plenty to suit any perspective homeowner or tenant looking to live or invest in this thriving area.Residents: Popular with city professionals working in the area, Canary Wharf provides an easy commute and plenty of opportunities for after work activities. The area is also popular with students and families, and provides exciting opportunities for investors and first-time buyers. The area has a mix of rental and owner–occupied properties.Going Out: Eating: With a plethora of places to eat, including Michelin star restaurants and well-known eateries, you’re spoiled for choice in Canary Wharf. Two Michelin star restaurant Tom’s Kitchen offers a relaxed dining experience serving French classics with a contemporary touch, always using the finest ingredients. Indulge in Boisdales famous steaks and whiskey while listening to live jazz music, or enjoy Japanese delights in the heart of Canary Wharf at the famous Roka.For after work drinks that wow, get to the top of Pan Peninsula, featuring stunning views of Canary Wharf and a tasty cocktail menu with happy hour 5-7pm, The Attic Bar is sure to please. Serious cocktail enthusiasts will love The Parlour, who serve innovative seasonal delights, alongside favourite classics. Relaxing summertime drinks don’t get better than at Brodie’s Bar & Kitchen, with an enviable waterside location, perfect for laid back al fresco drinking and dining.Things to do: Head to the Museum of London Docklands and learn more about the history of the area, with highly informative exhibitions showing how this riverside area has developed since the Roman times. Only 1 mile from the glistening towers of Canary Wharf, and you can be in the countryside at Mudchute park and city farm, providing endless free family fun with 32 acres hosting a range of activities including horse-riding and animal encounters. There are plenty of shopping opportunities in Canary Wharf, with over 120 shops ranging from designer brands, including Aspinal of London, Tiffany Co & Jo Malone, to high street favourites like Topshop and Zara. If you fancy you can even visit the famous Billingsgate Market, the uk’s largest inland wholesale fish market. Visit Europe’s largest luxury health club at Third Space, featuring state-of-the-art training facilities and 210 classes per week, more than enough for any fitness fanatic and anyone looking to inject some luxury into their fitness routine. Also in the area is the famous O2 arena, host to some of the world’s biggest bands, the enormous venue also includes a cinema, exhibition space and various bars and restaurants.Transport: Located on the West India Docks on the Isle of Dogs, Canary Wharf is very well connected, with the Jubilee Line allowing quick and easy access into central London, while the DLR serves the whole of the Isle of Dogs and area surrounding Canary Wharf, including Stratford and London City airport within 20 minutes. There are many options for buses into the city, and you can even travel by boat with regular services from Canary Wharf Pier to locations including London Bridge, Chelsea, Embankment, and nearby Greenwich. The future Crossrail development, set to open in 2018, will make journeys into the city even easier and faster.Council and tax bands Canary Wharf is represented by Tower Hamlets Council.

With the surge of highly polished property continually hitting the market, it's refreshing to see something of an opportunity to buy a raw industrial space that offers an opportunity to put your own interior stamp on.Limehouse Cut in fashionable East London is now something of a landmark building and part of a cluster of warehouses that were a pioneering scheme in the mid 1980's.It's also a hugely popular building with the creative world, some of the original residents still live here, a testament to community spirit that's still very much in existence.Heading up to the 4th and complete with its own private roof terrace, this largely untouched and mainly open plan warehouse offers genuine a opportunity to create that dream space. Currently the layout has three bedroom areas with the main living space divide by stud wall and sealed doors. Opening the whole place up should be a straightforward affair.Beyond this, the generous ceiling height allows for an additional mezzanine area to play with.There are also two kitchens, clearly if this were a classic loft space, one would be removed and very easily. The main kitchen area located in the main living space sits next to wonderfully rustic Critall doors opening to that generous private terrace.We could wax lyrical for ages about what you could do but the best thing is to decide for yourself.The East side location of the building provides good transport links. The DLR is just minutes on foot at Langdon Park and Bromley By Bow Tube (District and Hammersmith & City) is also close by. Weekend meanders are catered for on Fish Island in Hackney Wick plus Westfield Stratford. For the more hard core, Shoreditch is a short bus/Uber ride away.The apartment also comes with a secure, covered parking space.

description: This beautifully proportioned penthouse apartment on Morris Road has been elegantly refurbished to provide bright and expansive living space surrounded on two sides by an impressive private roof terrace. The apartment is located in one of the East End’s original warehouse conversions, formerly the old Spratts dog biscuit factory, which was converted by a consortium of artists in the 1980s and sold as shells to painters and sculptors, many of whom still live and work in the building today.Situated on the top floor, with wonderful views of the London skyline, the property is accessed through a gated courtyard that contains demised parking for residents. There is lift access to all floors.The apartment has a fantastic sense of volume owing to an exposed double-height pitched roof punctured with high-level windows that bathe the space in light. The main living areas are positioned on the lower level, whilst a generous mezzanine provides a dramatic space for the bedroom which has access to a south east-facing balcony. A half level up is a smaller contained space which can be used as a second bedroom, study or dressing room.Adjoining the main reception room is a cleverly designed conservatory that the current owner uses as a ceramics studio. The glazed roof maximises the intake of natural light and provides an additional space that can be contained from the otherwise open-plan living arrangement.The apartment is situated on the Limehouse Cut Canal in a vibrant area undergoing major redevelopment. Within ten minutes’ walk are Chrisp Street Market, designed by Frederick Gibberd and built as part of the 1951 Festival of Britain, and the recently renovated Grade-ii listed Poplar Baths & leisure centre. The canal path runs to Limehouse Marina in one direction and Bromley-by-Bow and the historic Three Mills Island in the other. There are lots of local parks and green spaces in the area with Mile End and Victoria Park a short walk away. The shops and restaurants of Canary Wharf are nearby, and can be reached on foot or by DLR from Langdon Park. The Jubilee Line and London Overground can also be accessed at Canary Wharf, for quick journeys into central London, Stratford and Shoreditch.Tenure: Leasehold with Share of FreeholdLease Length: Approx 965 yearsService Charge: Approx. £2,600 per annum (includes sinking fund of approx. £801)Parking: This apartment comes with the use of a space in the underground car park

description: About CeylonThe Latest Building to be released, comprising of only 9 floors. Most of the apartments in Ceylon come either with a terrace or a balcony looking onto secluded gardens and beautifully designed open spaces.Living spaces at Goodluck Hope are a re-interpretation of the warehouse aesthetic, where the industrial past has been transformed. The design of living spaces throughout acknowledges the texture and strength of raw natural material resulting in a universally refined aesthetic and a welcoming, familiar atmosphere. Carefully chosen features, including uniquely designed faucets, machine made in brass and carrying the Goodluck Hope maker's mark, are symbols of craft and ingenuity and the development's attention to the smallest detail.About Goodluck HopeGoodluck Hope is an industrially inspired luxury development, forged from London's enduring spirit, founded on an island heritage of industry, ingenuity and craft. It is a special project perfectly balancing waterfront prestige with the character of East London's creative culture.Goodluck Hope houses the exclusive '1595 Club' - a network of globally inspired exceptional amenities under one roof where residents can enjoy first class facilities to provide the finest in wellness, co-working and entertainment. The '1595 Club' consists of:The Picture House - on site cinema using state of the art sound and technologyThe Water House - 460 sqm swimming poolThe Steam House - Scandinavian style steam roomThe Sweat House - a New York inspired gymnasiumThe Work House - business centreThe Spice House - restaurant with panoramic viewsThe Lantern Room - 29th floor spectacular viewing lounge and barOne of the best connected sites in London with a 8 minute walk to its very own Jubilee Line and DLR station at Canning Town, 20 minutes to Bond Street, 15 minutes to Westminster. The easy access to the Jubilee line means one stop to the world's most successful music venue at the O2 and two stops to one of Europe's largest retail centers, Westfield at Stratford and Queen Elizabeth Park.

We do not warrant or accept any responsibility for the accuracy or completeness of the property descriptions provided here and cannot be held liable subject to contract. Please contact us directly for full details and further information on any point that is important to you.**Canary WharfOverview:An iconic London skyline, Canary Wharf is well known for being a worldwide leading financial and business centre, home to some of the largest global headquarters of major banks, media organisations and professional services firms. With over 100,000 people working in Canary Wharf at offices including those of hsbc, Barclays, Credit Suisse, Citigroup, kpmg and Morgan Stanley.Did you know?• In 1802, West India Docks were the world’s busiest shipping port and the heart of the British Empire.• Canary wharf is home to the biggest Waitrose in the country.• The average salary for Canary Wharf is £100,000• 1,000 ships still pass through the docks each month.Property:Growing in popularity, Canary Wharf is now home to many prestigious residential developments, along with an impressive array of restaurants, bars, shops and leisure facilities, making it a highly desirable place to work and live. Sleek modern apartments with breath-taking views of the River Thames are just some of the fantastic properties on offer at Canary Wharf, the area has a multitude of housing styles. From luxury penthouses and modern warehouse conversions to Victorian terrace houses, there is plenty to suit any perspective homeowner or tenant looking to live or invest in this thriving area.Residents:Popular with city professionals working in the area, Canary Wharf provides an easy commute and plenty of opportunities for after work activities. The area is also popular with students and families, and provides exciting opportunities for investors and first-time buyers. The area has a mix of rental and owner–occupied properties.Going Out:Eating:With a plethora of places to eat, including Michelin star restaurants and well-known eateries, you’re spoiled for choice in Canary Wharf.Two Michelin star restaurant Tom’s Kitchen offers a relaxed dining experience serving French classics with a contemporary touch, always using the finest ingredients. Indulge in Boisdales famous steaks and whiskey while listening to live jazz music, or enjoy Japanese delights in the heart of Canary Wharf at the famous Roka.Drinking:For after work drinks that wow, get to the top of Pan Peninsula, featuring stunning views of Canary Wharf and a tasty cocktail menu with happy hour 5-7pm, The Attic Bar is sure to please. Serious cocktail enthusiasts will love The Parlour, who serve innovative seasonal delights, alongside favourite classics. Relaxing summertime drinks don’t get better than at Brodie’s Bar & Kitchen, with an enviable waterside location, perfect for laid back al fresco drinking and dining.Things to do:Head to the Museum of London Docklands and learn more about the history of the area, with highly informative exhibitions showing how this riverside area has developed since the Roman times.Only 1 mile from the glistening towers of Canary Wharf, and you can be in the countryside at Mudchute park and city farm, providing endless free family fun with 32 acres hosting a range of activities including horse-riding and animal encounters.There are plenty of shopping opportunities in Canary Wharf, with over 120 shops ranging from designer brands, including Aspinal of London, Tiffany Co & Jo Malone, to high street favourites like Topshop and Zara. If you fancy you can even visit the famous Billingsgate Market, the uk’s largest inland wholesale fish market.Visit Europe’s largest luxury health club at Third Space, featuring state-of-the-art training facilities and 210 classes per week, more than enough for any fitness fanatic and anyone looking to inject some luxury into their fitness routine.Also in the area is the famous O2 arena, host to some of the world’s biggest bands, the enormous venue also includes a cinema, exhibition space and various bars and restaurants.Transport:Located on the West India Docks on the Isle of Dogs, Canary Wharf is very well connected, with the Jubilee Line allowing quick and easy access into central London, while the DLR serves the whole of the Isle of Dogs and area surrounding Canary Wharf, including Stratford and London City airport within 20 minutes. There are many options for buses into the city, and you can even travel by boat with regular services from Canary Wharf Pier to locations including London Bridge, Chelsea, Embankment, and nearby Greenwich. The future Crossrail development, set to open in 2018, will make journeys into the city even easier and faster.Council and tax bandsCanary Wharf is represented by Tower Hamlets Council.

Flamborough Walk consists of a handful of 19th Century homes all benefiting from charming front gardens. This three double bedroom cottage, arranged over two floors, with character apparent throughout. The charming separate kitchen is quirky with a range cooker, views onto the square and the private internal patio. Currently used as a potter’s studio, the courtyard would make a beautiful winter garden or an alternative dining experience in the summer – benefiting from midday sun.The two receptions rooms are at the front of the cottage beautifully decorated Victorian cornice and original wood flooring; south facing with views of the garden.The first floor houses the three bedrooms all with equally unique and interesting features. The back bedroom benefits from views on the square and a skylight inviting lots of natural light.The master bedroom and the additional guest room both look on to the garden and walkway below.Additionally, the family bathroom has a separate W.C. And a custom cast iron bath.Notes from the vendor:“Flamborough Walk is an extraordinary surprise. It’s a little bit of rus in urbe, a sliver of the countryside transplanted to a quintessential London setting, and Hawthorn Cottage sits at its entrance with the demeanor of a Regency cottage in a Suffolk village. The blackbirds may have to sing a little louder than country ones, but the DLR and the Fridge Extension (aka Tesco) are literally around the corner. The Walk is also a rare survival of a bit of East End history, as it was probably built for the managers of Limehouse Basin, which had a big trade in transshipment of coal from the Whitby colliers (in which Captain James Cook learnt his trade) to the canal boats, and the local place names reflect the Yorkshire origins of the coat – York, Flamborough and Durham.”

Shard and River View Two Bed in The Wardian | 22nd Floor | Dual Aspect South West | 840 sqft internal area | 346 SqFt Wrap Around 'Garden Balcony' | 25m Athletic Heated Outdoor Pool | 53rd Level Sky lounge inclusive of Private Dining and Bar | 24Hr Concierge | Gym | Spa | 999 years Lease | 0.2 Miles to Canary Wharf Underground | Completion expected mid September/ mid October 2020The apartment benefits from a spacious open plan kitchen/living area with floor to ceiling windows providing lots of stunning natural light, two double bedrooms, a luxury bathroom, en-suite to master and a rare expansive outdoor area.Comprising two iconic apartment towers with restaurants, curated shops and stunning facilities, the vision is to create a new address like no other, a haven of peace and beauty in the heart of London.Combining modern architecture with innovative landscaping, Wardian London sets a new standard for the high-rise living experience, put simply, a tranquil haven of nature in the heart of London's new financial centre.There is so much on offer with this fantastic development including a beautiful residents-only private dining area, iconic pool, cinema, gymnasium, sky lounge with bar on the 53rd floor, and a stunning sky garden provides breath-taking views Of Canary Wharf waterways and towards the river.Why Wardian? Because the towers design has been inspired by the work of one Londoner, the great explorer, botanist, and inventor, Nathaniel Bagshaw Ward. A doctor by trade, he changed the world with his botanical glass container, the deceptively simple-looking Wardian case, and while contemporary renderings of that aesthetic are a defining feature of Wardian, the influence goes beyond the mere visible. The vision for Wardian is to take inspiration from his curiosity, his spirit of adventure and his sense of precision, and to create the most exciting new development in the British capital.LeisureThis property is ideally situated for Canary Wharf, with popular destinations such as Canary Wharf Shopping Centre and the O2 for an indoor arena, restaurants, a cinema and bars. Video walk through available - Here we have an exceptional three bedroom flat in Medland House, with excellent views across the Limehouse Marina, E14.Some of the features to note are - a bright and spacious (990sqft/92m2) triple aspect reception room, a large sunny balcony with basin views, an updated contemporary fully fitted kitchen which is open plan to the reception room, new Amtico flooring throughout, two updated bathrooms (One being en-suite to the master bedroom), excellent storage, and secure underground parking.Medland House, built by Bellway back in 1998, enjoys a prominent position on the Limehouse Basin, with an on-site daily porter (24hr security), access to a landscaped communal garden with water feature and views across the Limehouse basin, and easy access to the Limehouse DLR station. Transport links couldn’t be better, with the DLR taking you into the City (Bank) or Canary Wharf in under 10 minutes either way. You can also pick up the C2C from Limehouse, which takes you into Fenchurch Street or the Essex Coast.The River Thames is also moments away, and runs parallel to Narrow Street which is the main street in Limehouse. You can quite easily walk down to Canary Wharf via Narrow Street, cutting through to Canary Riverside further down. Narrow Street itself offers a few well regarded bars/pubs/restaurants (Gordon Ramsey's, The Narrow & The historic Grapes pub, which is part owned by Sir Ian McKellen), which come with great views across the River Thames, a friendly atmosphere and excellent food and beverages.Canary Wharf also offers a multitude of bars restaurants and shops, including John Lewis/Waitrose, Marks & Spencer’s, Goldsmiths, and Hugo Boss, to name a few.This property needs to be viewed to be fully appreciated.

Narrow Street itself offers a few well regarded bars/pubs/restaurants (Gordon Ramsey's, The Narrow & The historic Grapes pub which is part owned by Sir Ian McKellen), which usually come with great views across the River Thames. Douglass Tower offers residents the ultimate experience, with flexible living, working convenience and panoramic views across London and beyond.Living spaces at Goodluck Hope are a re-interpretation of the warehouse aesthetic, where the industrial past has been transformed. The design of living spaces throughout acknowledges the texture and strength of raw natural material resulting in a universally refined aesthetic and a welcoming, familiar atmosphere. Carefully chosen features, including uniquely designed faucets, machine made in brass and carrying the Goodluck Hope maker's mark, are symbols of craft and ingenuity and the development's attention to the smallest detail.About Goodluck HopeGoodluck Hope is an industrially inspired luxury development, forged from London's enduring spirit, founded on an island heritage of industry, ingenuity and craft. It is a special project perfectly balancing waterfront prestige with the character of East London's creative culture.Goodluck Hope houses the exclusive '1595 Club' - a network of globally inspired exceptional amenities under one roof where residents can enjoy first class facilities to provide the finest in wellness, co-working and entertainment. The '1595 Club' consists of:The Picture House - on site cinema using state of the art sound and technologyThe Water House - 460 sqm swimming poolThe Steam House - Scandinavian style steam roomThe Sweat House - a New York inspired gymnasiumThe Work House - business centreThe Spice House - restaurant with panoramic viewsThe Lantern Room - 29th floor spectacular viewing lounge and barOne of the best connected sites in London with a 8 minute walk to its very own Jubilee Line and DLR station at Canning Town, 20 minutes to Bond Street, 15 minutes to Westminster. The easy access to the Jubilee line means one stop to the world's most successful music venue at the O2 and two stops to one of Europe's largest retail centers, Westfield at Stratford and Queen Elizabeth Park.

Franklyn James are proud to present this exceptionally rare treasure of a property, built in the 1920’s as a home for the heroes. This freehold house oozes character and exhibits a century of history in the heart of the East End, situated on one of E14’s most sought after streets. This dazzling dockers cottage comprises a spacious reception room with wooden flooring, separate fully fitted kitchen with doors leading out into a stunning rear conservatory overlooking a large private garden. Downstairs you will also find a three-piece bathroom suite. Up the stairs you will discover a large master bedroom paired with an en-suite shower room, and two good sized bedrooms.Thermopylae Gate is within close walking distance to Mudchute DLR providing quick and easy access to Canary Wharf, The City and to Greenwich. Forming part of a conservation area there are several parks and walking trails nearby along with a good choice of shops and supermarkets. Canary Wharf College, one of London’s most sought after schools, is stationed just at the end of the road.Owners thoughts;I discovered the oasis of 35 Thermopylae Gate while working in Canary Wharf. It is an intact historical gem, minutes by foot or bike to the brash and shining towers. A timeless throwback to an era when people had front and back gardens. The Georgean-era house has all that. There are allotments on the doorstep to grow your organic veggies, the extraordinary foot tunnel under the Thames to Greenwich. On Saturday's we loved wandering over to The Gun for lunch, a place Lord Nelson used to secretly visit.

displayable_address: Bramley Fall Moorings, Pepper Street, London E14
agent_name: riverhomes, South West & Central London office
description: Five new luxury wide beam boats, each for sale on new residential moorings at Bramley Falls Marina in Millwall Outer Dock on the Isle of Dogs, close to Canary Wharf, providing a rare opportunity to buy a brand new floating home in central London.The new boats are priced from £295,000, plus a £15,000 per annum mooring fee. Each boat will have: Two or three bedrooms (with a king sized bed in the master cabin with pop up TV in the foot board); a bathroom with a bath, separate shower, toilet, two sinks and underfloor heating; a kitchen with quartz work surfaces, a five-burner hob, fridge freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, wine fridge, Smeg appliances and integrated microwave; and a spacious lounge with a diesel fuel stove. The boats will have central heating throughout, a 5G antenna and will be wired to accommodate solar panels.The new residential moorings come with a 25 year transferable mooring agreement. The gated Bramley Falls Marina is a short walk from the dlr’s South Quay and Crossharbour stations, in easy reach of Canary Wharf. Bramley Falls moorings provide a secure location with CCTV, remote access gate control, LED lighting and storage boxes. The moorings will be managed by the Canal & River Trust’s Waterside Mooring subsidiary. The mooring fee is fixed until April 2024.LocationBramley Falls is city living at its best: In fact, the Isle of Dogs where this mooring is located was the winner of the 2019 Sunday Times Best Place to Live in London.Situated in the historic trading site of Millwall Outer Dock, your mooring is tucked away from the main path of the River Thames but gives you unrivalled access to everything this part of London has to offer.Canary Wharf is just minutes away and the city is a fifteen-minute ride on the DLR. But the area is surprisingly green with Island Gardens, Millwall Park and Mudchute City Farm being a few of the outdoor spaces to enjoy.A foot tunnel takes you under the river to Greenwich where you’ll find museums, markets, restaurants and the entertainment riches of the O2 complex.

agent_name: riverhomes, South West & Central London office
description: Riverhomes is delighted to bring to market this stunning 94ft x 14ft Classic Luxe Motor. She is generously proportioned for year round habitation and is fully navigable and certified for cruising, with sleeping accommodation for up to 7 people. "Sirius" is in Limehouse Basin on a residential mooring, enjoying views of the marina and skyscape of Canary Wharf. Constructed in 1929, she was converted into a hotel barge in 1982 and then renovated in 2008 for personal use. The kitchen was updated in 2019. The wheelhouse is varnished teak with 3 panel roof sections that are fully de-mountable and the sides fold down, taking her from 3.25m to 2.55m air draught.The accommodation consists of an open-plan kitchen/living room with additional storage cupboards port and starboard. One of the unique features of this area are the eight hinged panels providing access to further large storage areas underneath the floor. Forward of the living room, along a hallway, you enter two/three guest suites, each with their own washing amenities. Aft of the wheelhouse, down a flight of varnished stairs, you enter the rear cabin. Built on the footprint of the original captain’s cabin, it has been renovated and upgraded with all teak built-in furniture. There's a double bed; built-in dresser/desk; shower, sink and window for ventilation. Outside, there is a decked area with plenty of room for a table and chairs or a corner sofa, perfect for enjoying the sunshine, a BBQ and views.There is mains-fed electricity, fibre broadband wi-fi and water supply at the pontoon. This is a secure gated marina, offering tranquillity and a sense of community with other boat dwellers in a prime central London location.

agent_name: riverhomes, South West & Central London office
description: This converted coastal barge was originally built in 1958 in Goole and offers 1,840 sq. Ft. / 171 sq. M. Of accommodation. Moored in Poplar Dock Marina since the late 90's it has been used as a full-time residence for the last 20 years. The interior begins with a wheelhouse with all associated instrumentation in place as well as being used as a sufficiently spacious saloon. Stairs lead down to a well proportioned living area with enough room for a large dining table. There is a bedroom and bathroom as well as an option to add an additional guest WC. On the lower deck are four further bedrooms, a shower room and the engine room to the rear.Poplar Dock Marina is a well-established and incredibly sedate community of houseboats within sight of Canary Wharf, where a wide range of restaurants, cafes and increasingly popular shopping facilities are found. Local transport options include DLR services into The City (Tower Hill) from Blackwall station, River Bus services east towards Greenwich and west to Vauxhall/Nine Elms Lane via The City and a variety of local bus routes. Mooring Charges are £10,500pa.Unless riverhomes notifies you in writing, we are only selling this vessel and not the mooring. The rental of the mooring is by separate negotiation with the marina or mooring management, all prospective buyers should make their own enquiries with them directly to understand the ingoing costs and mooring fees payable by a new owner. Any mooring fees given here or verbally are approximate and intended as a guide only.

description: This charming Dutch barge is being offered on a residential mooring in Limehouse Basin Marina. The vessel provides a fantastic opportunity for a permanent home, holiday base or pied-a-terre. The open-plan living area gives the boat a light and airy feel with a generous living space, fully fitted kitchen and breakfast bar. The deck provides a fantastic space perfect for entertaining or just sitting and enjoying the tranquillity of Limehouse marina. There are three bedrooms, a modern bathroom with shower and large wheelhouse. The marina has mains-fed electricity, broadband wi-fi and water supply at the pontoon. It is a secure gated pontoon, offering a sense of community and peace, with other boat dwellers in a superb location.Unless riverhomes notifies you in writing, we are only selling this vessel and not the mooring. description: This exceptional and fully operational Dutch Barge has become available for sale. Moored on a secure residential mooring in Poplar Dock Marina, it comprises a large wheelhouse, enjoying great marina and skyline views. There's a large open-plan reception room and fully-fitted kitchen with modern appliances. Many original features are retained and there's an abundance of natural light comes from the many skylights and portholes throughout.The bedroom is a good size and has integrated mood lighting and a fully-fitted walk-in wardrobe featuring leather wall and door fittings. The bathroom has a full sized bath, wash hand basin and toilet. There is also a separate tiled wet room. There's also an engine room and outside deck area, perfect for al-fresco dining.The gated marina provides a caretaker during the day and night security. There's 24 hour CCTV; internet and residents’ parking (at extra cost.), It's only minutes from Canary Wharf Jubilee line, DLR and Crossrail - when it comes!. Blackwall DLR is just 5 minutes away, as are the restaurants and cafés of Canary Wharf. The marina benefits from a strong community spirit plus facilities including communal social area with outdoor heaters, toilets, showers and free laundry. The marina provides water points and electric (at extra cost) to all moored boats.

description: This houseboat is moored in Poplar Dock Marina close to Canary Wharf. The barge was built in Belgium, the 4th vessel to be built at the Rupelmonde yard, just outside Antwerp.The boat features 3 cabins, fully-fitted kitchen in the wheelhouse, large saloon with wood burning stove and a modernised shower room.Poplar Dock Marina has been designed to offer boaters the highest quality facilities available in terms of safety, security, comfort and style. Full DescriptionNova Cura is a beautiful 21m early 20th century Dutch barge that has been extensively renovated in the last few years, she is offered on a fully transferable residential mooring in Canary Wharf.You enter from the super large back deck through an old wooden hatch into a large bright open plan kitchen/living room with hardwood floor throughout. The kitchen itself has a very modern feel with lots of work space and all the mod cons you’d expect, fridge freezer, large electric oven and hob, a washer/dryer and plenty of storage. This then leads you nicely into the spacious living room with space enough for a big sofa, tv, excellent modern fireplace and even a dining area as well, from there you’re lend down a long corridor boasting storage all down the way down its side at the end is a comfortable work space with desk and chair. Coming off the corridor is the main bedroom with plenty of space for a king sized bed as well as lots of storage, next to this is the large shower room and toilet which was completely refitted only 2 years ago, at the bottom of the corridor is the second bedroom and once again a lot more storage.She is perfect accommodation for anyone seeking a new home in a prime London location. She is currently moored in the amazing surroundings of Poplar Dock Marina in the historical West India Docks - Canary Wharf.The fully transferable residential mooring is around £1000 per month and includes council tax, WiFi and water rates. The gated marina offers night security and a caretaker during the day. The mooring benefits from a remarkable community and a large community BBQ area with loungers and is protected from all the elements. Separate toilet/shower facility with laundry room and Elsan, all of which are free to use as is the pump out. Car parking spaces are available for an additional £600 per year.

description: Guide Price £150,000 - £200,000 Stunning 61ft. X 11ft6. Dutch barge on a leisure mooring in Limehouse, with views of the marina and the skyscape of Canary Wharf.The boat was built in 2007 and has a high quality finish bespoke internal fit out was carried out by the previous owner. This fully navigable vessel could be used to cruise around London or just as a floating apartment/pied-à-terre based in a prime Central London location.Accommodation comprises; entry into a good size wheelhouse with navigation controls, seating and a table, moving down to the rear of the boat is the master bedroom suite with a modern shower room. On the other side of the wheelhouse is the main living area which has a stunning open plan fitted kitchen, a breakfast bar and then a living area with built in corner sofa and table, built in storage along side of the boat. Above deck there is a decked area with a table and chairs which is perfect for enjoying the sunshine and views. The boat has a brand new Kabola diesel central heating and hot water system, installed Feb 2019.The marina has mains-fed electricity, broadband wi-fi, and water supply at the pontoon. It is a secure gated pontoon, offering a sense of community and tranquility with other boat dwellers in a superb location.

*shared ownership with 30% share* Franklyn James are proud to present this remarkable two double bedroom apartment in the newly built sought-after Ballymore development. This bright apartment is situated on the second floor and compromises of two spacious double bedrooms, an expansive open plan living kitchen area with fully equipped integrated appliances and four-piece family bathroom suite. Further benefits include on-site 24-hour security, floor to ceiling windows, large private balcony, and secure underground bike storage.Jessop Building is set in a family-friendly and residential area with a real community feel, this property is within walking distance of Blackwall station for DLR access as well as Canary Wharf Station for Jubilee Line access and the forthcoming Crossrail for an easy commute to the City and Heathrow Airport. The property is surrounded by the banks of River Thames for lovely evening strolls or morning runs and with Canary Wharf set within walking distance, you can find a collection of bars, restaurants and local amenities all on your doorstep.N order to be eligible for the shared price, a buyer must meet the following:• Be at least 18 years old• Have an annual household of less than £90,000• Be first time buyers or if they do already own a home, they must be in the process of selling it• Be able to demonstrate that they have a good credit history (no bad debts or County Court Judgements) and can afford the regular payments and costs involved in buying a home• Satisfy the affordability assessment carried out by our appointed Independent Financial Advisor, using no more than 45% of their net monthly income (minus commitments) on their housing costs.If an offer is accepted, all purchasers will need to provide the following:• Photo page of passport (and visas if applicable)• Payslips covering the last three consecutive months and latest P60 for employed applicants or the last three years of audited accounts and SA302 forms with accompanying Tax Year Overview from the hmrc for self employed applicants• Itemised bank statement covering the last three consecutive months. This should show salary and rental payments• Proof of savings or a gift letter accompanied by evidence of available funds that must be sufficient to cover buying costs and a mortgage deposit• Current loan and credit card statements covering the last three consecutive months• Two items of proof of your residential address for example a utility bill or council tax bill. Mobile phone bills are not an acceptable form of proof of address.

This is an ideal purchase for an individual looking to get onto the property ladder!In order to be eligible for the shared price, a buyer must meet the following:• Be at least 18 years old• Have an annual household of less than £90,000• Be first time buyers or if they do already own a home, they must be in the process of selling it• Be able to demonstrate that they have a good credit history (no bad debts or County Court Judgements) and can afford the regular payments and costs involved in buying a home• Satisfy the affordability assessment carried out by our appointed Independent Financial Advisor, using no more than 45% of their net monthly income (minus commitments) on their housing costs.If an offer is accepted, all purchasers will need to provide the following:• Photo page of passport (and visas if applicable)• Payslips covering the last three consecutive months and latest P60 for employed applicants or the last three years of audited accounts and SA302 forms with accompanying Tax Year Overview from the hmrc for self employed applicants• Itemised bank statement covering the last three consecutive months. This should show salary and rental payments• Proof of savings or a gift letter accompanied by evidence of available funds that must be sufficient to cover buying costs and a mortgage deposit• Current loan and credit card statements covering the last three consecutive months• Two items of proof of your residential address for example a utility bill or council tax bill. Mobile phone bills are not an acceptable form of proof of address.

agent_name: riverhomes, South West & Central London office
description: This steel hulled Dutch barge with working engine was built over 100 years ago and was converted into a charming home in 2006. The impressive upper deck space is a fantastic alternative to a garden and sits atop a generously proportioned interior that encompasses 515 sq. Ft. / 47.8 sq. M. Of accommodation that includes a wheelhouse to the upper deck, which would equally well as an office or reception, a saloon with wood or coal burning stove, two bedrooms, a kitchen and bathroom. Additional features include diesel central heating, gas boiler, a mixture of port-hole and conventional windows, wood flooring and easily accessible engine room and aft end storage.Unless riverhomes notifies you in writing, we are only selling this vessel and not the mooring. The rental of the mooring is by separate negotiation with the marina or mooring management, all prospective buyers should make their own enquiries with them directly to understand the ingoing costs and mooring fees payable by a new owner. Any mooring fees given here or verbally are approximate and intended as a guide only.

Full DescriptionVerandering is a beautiful 62ft foot Dutch Barge offered on a residential mooring, in the idyllic surroundings of the historic West India Quay, Canary Wharf.The barge is fitted to a good standard throughout with two good size double bedrooms and a stunning newly fitted shower room. You enter through the wheelhouse which has a fitted dinning area which also doubles as a guest double bed, heading on down the stairs takes you in to an open plan living and kitchen area, which is light and airy, there is a large wood burning stove and plenty of built in storage and a lovely big built in book case, the kitchen is simple but well proportioned with lots of storage, a breakfast bar, built in oven an hob, washing machine and large fridge/freezer. Down the corridor on the left is the newly fitted shower room with pumpout toilet, this room was completely rebuilt by dgm design only a few months ago. The first of the bedrooms is next which is currently used as a large study, but could easily be a second double by adding a bed. At the end of the corridor is the master bedroom which has good storage and plenty of space for the large double bed.The boat is moored at Canary Wharf on a residential mooring which costs around £1000 pcm and is transferable for a fee of 5% + vat (of the sale price) payable to the marina management. The mooring cost also includes free use of onsite facilities pumpout, shower rooms, laundry and the community bbq area, as well as free WiFi, water and council tax is also included. The marina has excellent 24 hours security with caretakers on during the day to help with any problems, parking is available at an extra £695 per year.
